page.title: 09Gatherley & Turchington Area
page.content: This area is truly rural and of outstanding natural beauty. Gatherley has been farmed by the same family for four generations. Three sons hope to carry on well into the next century. Turchington is in the same ownership, both mixed farming, beef cattle, and sheep, growing 70 acres of barley, cutting grass for hay and silage, growing rest of crops for cattle feed. Market outlets are Kaunceston and Holsworthy. About 140 acres of woodland, felled during the second world war, has regrown. Oak, beech, ash, sycamore, hazel. elder, thorn and rhodedendron. Woodland animals roam freely. New conifer plantation. Wild flowers grow in abundance, daffodils, primroses, bluebells, wood anemonies, fox gloves, king cups, and vipers blue gloss. The Tamar forms W boundary of Gatherley,fish brown trout & salmon.
